summary: Email correspondence between an Assistant United States Attorney and FBI Special Agents regarding a request for historical service provider information for phone numbers associated with Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell during an investigation period.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Phone numbers associated with his New York office and cell phone are requested for service provider information during the relevant time period.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Phone numbers associated with her home and cell are requested for service provider information during the relevant time period.

connections.description: Both are subjects of the same investigation, with their phone records being sought concurrently by prosecutors.

events.title: Phone records provider inquiry
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney requests service provider information for phone numbers linked to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell from FBI agents.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Prosecutors from the Southern District of New York were actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell as of May 2019.
The investigation involved seeking historical service provider data for phone numbers associated with Epstein's NY office, Epstein's cell, Maxwell's home, and Maxwell's cell.
The FBI's New York VCAC/Human Trafficking unit was involved in the investigative correspondence.
The listed telecommunications providers of interest were T-Mobile, AT&T, and Verizon.
